docs.lead_paragraph: As more and more of the costs of care are shifted to consumers, people are going to need more credit. They are still going to need health care. RED GILLEN, of Celent, an insurance and banking research firm, on the rise in financing plans for doctors' bills. [A1]

docs.lead_paragraph: With Hurricane Katrina's devastation of the Gulf Coast being remembered on its second anniversary today, politicians, candidates and President Bush have descended on the region in force -- some with more promises, others with more proposals for rebuilding.
docs.abstract: Two years later, an anniversary in a region with loss and disaster still in abundant evidence.
docs.snippet: Two years later, an anniversary in a region with loss and disaster still in abundant evidence.

docs.lead_paragraph: From 2005 to 2006, the rich grew richer in the New York region and the poor, over all, remained poor, producing the widest income gap of any major metropolitan area.
